text: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
author: Cherie Gilderbloom

text: Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Herman Cain

text: Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Success is the child of audacity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: To have another language is to possess a second soul.
author: Charlemagne

text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: Cesare Pavese

text: Never make fun of someone who speaks broken English. It means they know another language.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: Always forgive your enemies. Nothing annoys them more.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Only two things are infinite â€” the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
author: Albert Einstein

text: No longer chasing butterflies, Camila and I planted our garden so they could come to us.
author: Matthew Mcconaughey

text: Fake It Until You Make It! Act As If You Had All The Confidence You Require Until It Becomes Your Reality.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Take the first step in faith. You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text: In the  middle  of  difficulty  lies  opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Success  is the  ability  to  go  from  failure  to  failure  without  losing  your  enthusiasm
author: Winston Churchill

text: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farrah Gray

text: The  biggest  risk  is  not  taking  any  risk.  In a  world  that's  changing  really  quickly, the only strategy  that  is  guaranteed  to  fail  is  not  taking  risks.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: If  you  love  something, set  it  free;  if  it  comes  back,  it's  yours.  If  it  doesn't  it  never  was.
author: Richard Bach
